column4: in debian/ubuntu I understand that update-rc.d is the redhat equivalent to chkconfig for adding and removing services within systemV. After scanning the man page it appears that it doesn't have something like chkconfig --list. What command can I use to achieve that?
Just checked the man page, perhaps I'm missing something... would you be so kind as to provide an example to list which services are set to run at various runlevels?
ls /etc/rc0.d will list procs running at rl 0
